definition: first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: As the bubble deflates, China's exports are normalizing.
sentences.chinese: 當泡沫消去，中國的出口亦迴歸正常化。

sentences.english: Normalization of Sino-U. S. relations was thus achieved.
sentences.chinese: 自此，中美關係實現正常化。

sentences.english: Both fiscal and monetary policy contributed to the normalization.
sentences.chinese: 財政和貨幣政策均對經濟正常化有所貢獻。

sentences.english: The two sides would like to see the normalisation of diplomatic relations.
sentences.chinese: 雙方都願意看到外交關係的正常化。

sentences.english: The report suggested that the "normalising" of splits could be to blame.
sentences.chinese: 報告稱正常化的離婚應該受到責備。

sentences.english: Allow freer capital flows in and out, to help normalize monetary policy?
sentences.chinese: 允許資本更加自由地出入，以推動貨幣政策正常化？

sentences.english: As the economy normalizes, consumption and investment will resume.
sentences.chinese: 隨着經濟的正常化，消費和投資都會恢復。

sentences.english: This will be a stabilizing force in Indian-Chinese relations.
sentences.chinese: 這將成爲中印關係正常化的定心丸。

sentences.english: As the bubble deflates, China's exports are normalising.
sentences.chinese: 當泡沫消去，中國的出口亦迴歸正常化。

sentences.english: China and Laos did not normalize ties until 1988.
sentences.chinese: 中國和老撾直到1988年才恢復邦交正常化。

sentences.english: This year marks the 35th anniversary of normalization of China-Japan diplomatic ties.
sentences.chinese: 今年恰逢中日邦交正常化35週年。

sentences.english: Hu said that China-Latvia relations have made smooth progress since the two countries normalized diplomatic ties.
sentences.chinese: 胡錦濤說，中拉關係正常化以來，兩國關係順利發展。

sentences.english: The deal is aimed at boosting commercial ties between the two rivals by normalizing trade arrangements.
sentences.chinese: 協議旨在通過貿易正常化來增強彼此間的商業聯繫。

sentences.english: Before relations were normalised between the US and China, we couldn't get in.
sentences.chinese: 直到中美關係正常化，我們才得以進入青藏高原。

sentences.english: By this time, the Sino-Soviet relationship had been completely normalized.
sentences.chinese: 到此時，中蘇關係完全正常化。

sentences.english: If the two conditions are unmet, normalization of ties is impossible.
sentences.chinese: 如果達不到這兩個條件，關係正常化是不可能的。

definition: US Federal Reserve (Fed), the US central bank
dove faction (opposite: 鹰派, hawks)/peace party/the faction seeking peace
abbr. for various central banks, notably 中國人民銀行|中国人民银行[Zhong1 guo2 Ren2 min2 Yin2 hang2] and 中央銀行|中央银行[Zhong1 yang1 Yin2 hang2]
progress step by step/gradual progress/to move forward (slowly)
hawk faction (opposite: 鸽派, doves)/fierce and combative party/war party/warmongers
Bernanke (name)/Ben Shalom Bernanke (1953-), US economist, Chairman of Fed from 2006
